column1: Written from [[18 April]] to [[6 May]] [[1963]] (suffering from symptoms of [[Wikipedia:Fibromyalgia|fibrositis]]
column2: he could not finish the letter at once)
column3: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to Mr and Mrs Kloos'''. Anneke C. Kloos-Adriaansen and P. Kloos were [[Wikipedia:Anthropology|anthropologists]].<ref name=CG>{{CG|C}}

column1: *'''Subject:''' Replying to their letter from [[23 March]]
column2: Tolkien writes at length about "his sources and inspiration for ''[[The Hobbit]]'' and ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''".<ref name=CG/>

column1: *'''Publication:''' Excerpts from the letter were published in ''[[The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion]]''.<ref name=RC>{{HM|RC}}

{{Quote|[The [[Gerontius Took|Old Took]]] has part of his origin in the fact that both my grandfathers were longeval. My [[John Benjamin Tolkien|father's father]] was in his eleventh year when [[Wikipedia:Battle of Waterloo|Waterloo]] was fought; my [[Tolkien Family|mother's father]]
column3: was born before [[Wikipedia:Queen Victoria|Queen Victoria]] came to the throne
column4: and survived till his ninety-ninth year
column5: missing his 'hundred' (with which he was as much concerned as [[Bilbo]] was to surpass the Old Took) only because he mowed a large lawn that spring and then sat in the wind without a jacket.|[[J.R.R. Tolkien]]<ref name=RC/>}}

column1: {{Quote|[The incidents of the [[Witch-king]]'s [[Morgul-knife|knife]] in [[Flight to the Ford|Book I
column3: and of [[Meriadoc Brandybuck|Merry]]'s [[Daggers of Westernesse|sword]] in [[The Battle of the Pelennor Fields|Book V
column4: Chapter 6]]] were intended to be integrated with the entire mytho-historical background
column5: events in an agelong war. [[Frodo]] received his wound from the Witchking under [[Weathertop]]
column6: the bulwark of the ancient fortified line made by the [[Númenóreans|Numenoreans]] against his kingdom; Meriadoc's dagger was taken from the gravemounds of the same people. It was made by smiths who knew all about [[Sauron]] and his servants
column7: and made in prophetic vision or hope of ending just as it did. [spellings ''sic'']|[[J.R.R. Tolkien]]<ref name=RC/>}}
